node.title: Who was Daunte Wright?
node.description: Mr. Wright, who was killed by an officer during a traffic stop, had been trying to improve his life for his young son, according to those who knew him.
node.content: ["Daunte Wright has been remembered by friends as upbeat and gregarious, someone who loved to play basketball and was a supportive father to his son, Daunte Jr., who was a year old when Mr. Wright, 20, was killed by a police officer during a traffic stop.", "\u201cHe always said he couldn\u2019t wait to make his son proud,\u201d Katie Wright, Mr. Wright\u2019s mother, said at his funeral in April. \u201cJunior was the joy of his life, and he lived for him every single day, and now he\u2019s not going to be able to see him.\u201d", "Mr. Wright\u2019s death came during a traffic stop in a Minneapolis suburb when an officer, Kimberly Potter, fired a single shot from her handgun, apparently mistaking it for her Taser.", "A little over a month after his death, a lawsuit against Mr. Wright\u2019s family raised questions about whether Mr. Wright was involved in a violent dispute in May 2019.", "The woman who filed the lawsuit claimed that Mr. Wright had shot her son \u2014 a former friend of his \u2014 in the head in Minneapolis leaving him severely disabled, possibly because the man had \u201cbeat up\u201d Mr. Wright earlier that month. The lawsuit offers no direct evidence tying Mr. Wright to the shooting, which remains unsolved. Katie Wright has called the claims hurtful, and told The Star Tribune: \u201cTo run with allegations like that is pretty bad, whether they are true or not true.\u201d", "During jury selection in Ms. Potter\u2019s manslaughter trial, in which 14 jurors \u2014 including two alternate jurors \u2014 were chosen, several said that they had seen news reports that Mr. Wright might have been involved in the shooting.", "The judge overseeing the trial of Ms. Potter has said Mr. Wright\u2019s conduct before he was killed \u2014 including the allegation that he shot the man and any previous arrests \u2014 can only be brought up at trial if it is shown that Ms. Potter knew about it at the time of the traffic stop.", "Many who knew Mr. Wright have acknowledged that he had made mistakes but had been trying to improve his life for his son.", "A friend, Emajay Driver, said that Mr. Wright had \u201cloved to make people laugh.\u201d As a freshman in high school, Mr. Wright had been voted a class clown. \u201cThere was never a dull moment,\u201d Mr. Driver said.", "Delivering a eulogy at the funeral, the Rev. Al Sharpton said he was told that Minneapolis had not seen a funeral procession so large since Prince, the musician who was born and raised in Minneapolis, died in 2016.", "\u201cYou thought he was just some kid with an air freshener,\u201d Mr. Sharpton said at Mr. Wright\u2019s funeral, referring to the air freshener hanging from his rearview mirror, which prosecutors said was one reason that the police stopped Mr. Wright\u2019s car. Mr. Sharpton added: \u201cHe was a prince, and all of Minneapolis has stopped today to honor the prince of Brooklyn Center.\u201d"]
